meanings.definition: To commit or promise more than one can deliver.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overcommit to too many tasks and end up feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: She always overcommits to social events and then has to cancel last minute.
meanings.sent3: I overcommit to baking cookies for everyone, but then they all turn out burnt!
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overcommit himself is like trying to fit a gallon of water in a pint-sized cup.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overcommitting are like carrying a load too heavy to bear.

meanings.definition: To pledge or obligate oneself beyond one's capacity or resources.
meanings.sent1: When I overcommit to too many projects, I end up exhausted and stressed.
meanings.sent2: They often overcommit to volunteering and find themselves stretched thin.
meanings.sent3: I overcommit to helping with every event, but sometimes I forget which ones I signed up for!
meanings.sent4: Her habit of overcommitting is like trying to juggle too many balls at once.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overcommitting financially can be like digging a hole too deep to climb out of.
